evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: Zachary expressed feeling overwhelmed by balancing coursework, social life, and side projects (student org and coding). He also mentioned struggling with time management and finding a mentor. Solutions offered/accepted: The AI Coach suggested time-blocking for better scheduling, breaking down the student org into smaller steps, dedicating specific time for coding, and reaching out to a professor for mentorship. Zachary responded positively, agreeing to try time-blocking and reaching out to a classmate about the org. He also expressed openness to contacting a professor. Evidence of progress/improvement: Zachary committed to mapping out his next three days, initiating contact with a classmate, and felt lighter and more optimistic after the conversation.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Balancing time between starting a student org and Econ studies, 2) Falling into unproductive Netflix zombie phases mid-semester, 3) Guilt from procrastination. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) 2-hour rule for org planning, 2) 5-minute trick for studying, 3) Slump buddy (Jamal) for accountability, 4) Scheduling zombie time for doomscrolling. Student's response to solutions: Positive, with immediate implementation of new routines and strategies. Evidence of progress/improvement: Created a detailed game plan, accepted strategic failure, and showed enthusiasm for trying new methods.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Zachary discussed feeling overwhelmed with juggling classes, starting a student org, and networking. Solutions offered included time-blocking with color-coded calendars, reframing networking as collecting stories, and using timers with rewards to combat procrastination. Zachary responded positively, planning to implement time-blocking, approach an econ professor casually, and use gummy bears as motivation. Evidence of progress includes his commitment to these strategies and reduced anxiety about networking and time management.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Networking anxiety and starting a student org, 2) Study distractions and time management, 3) Conversation anxiety during networking. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) 'Micro-networking' with one person in study group, 2) 'Power hour' technique for focused study, 3) Preparing three 'go-to' questions for networking. Student's response to solutions: Positive and actionable, immediately planned to text a peer for coffee and expressed enthusiasm for trying the 'power hour'. Evidence of progress/improvement: Demonstrated proactive behavior by setting up a networking meeting and showed reduced anxiety about networking through humor and planning.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Balancing honors coursework with starting a student org, 2) Overcommitting to academic tasks (e.g., reading 3 econ journals weekly), 3) Fear of lacking leadership experience. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) The 50% Discount rule to reduce overcommitment, 2) Blocking study sprints and setting a 24-Hour Rule for new tasks, 3) Using an 'Anti-Ghosting Alarm' for accountability. Student's response to solutions: Zach immediately drafted an email for the student org, blocked study times, and created a follow-up reminder. Evidence of progress/improvement: Zach acknowledged past overcommitment, adjusted his workload, and proposed a podcast as supplemental material, showing proactive problem-solving.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Feeling overwhelmed by balancing coursework, social life, and starting a student org, 2) Fear of failing with the student org, 3) Procrastinating on learning Python. Solutions offered/accepted: 1) Break down student org launch into manageable steps (visit Student Life, draft mission statement, host first event), 2) Acknowledge Python can wait and find humor in procrastination. Student's response to solutions: Energized and motivated, immediately texted roommate to join, planned to visit Student Life, and found relief in not pressuring himself about Python. Evidence of progress/improvement: Reduced anxiety, concrete steps taken toward student org launch, and positive attitude toward solutions.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Zachary's fear of social interactions in crowded places like the dining hall and his desire to start a student organization while managing time and anxiety. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: The AI Coach suggested starting with 'micro-interactions' to build confidence, recruiting 1-2 allies for the org, using the '5-second rule' to overcome overthinking, and preparing exit lines for awkward moments. 3) Student's response to solutions: Zachary enthusiastically accepted the solutions, particularly the data-driven approach to track progress and the 5-minute dining hall challenge. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: Zachary showed reduced anxiety (from 4/10 to 3.5/10), planned concrete actions (dining hall challenge, recruiting allies), and adopted a positive mindset towards social interactions.
